title: Chinese Government donates 20 trucks to Myanmar's Committee on Repatriation and Resettlement of Displaced People
description: According to the news releases from the Embassy of China in Myanmar and the Ministry of Information of Myanmar, on February 27, 2019, the Chinese government donated 20 Sinotruck Howo trucks to the Myanmar Committee on Repatriation and Resettlement of Displaced People. The handover ceremony was held at the National Centre for Reconciliation and Peace in Naypyidaw. The trucks will help the Myanmar government to transport displaced people from Rakhine State who have returned to Myanmar as part of the resettlement and repatriation process. According to the news release from Yunnan Gateway, previously, in December 2018, the Myanmar Government expressed its need for these 20 trucks.
combined_text:
# Sector
EMERGENCY RESPONSE

# Title
Chinese Government donates 20 trucks to Myanmar's Committee on Repatriation and Resettlement of Displaced People

# Description
According to the news releases from the Embassy of China in Myanmar and the Ministry of Information of Myanmar, on February 27, 2019, the Chinese government donated 20 Sinotruck Howo trucks to the Myanmar Committee on Repatriation and Resettlement of Displaced People. The handover ceremony was held at the National Centre for Reconciliation and Peace in Naypyidaw. The trucks will help the Myanmar government to transport displaced people from Rakhine State who have returned to Myanmar as part of the resettlement and repatriation process. According to the news release from Yunnan Gateway, previously, in December 2018, the Myanmar Government expressed its need for these 20 trucks.
justification: Project involves humanitarian aid for displaced people, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of trucks for repatriation and resettlement of displaced people, humanitarian focus

title: Chinese Embassy provides 5 off-road vehicles to the Myanmar Peace Commission
description: On May 3, 2019, the Chinese Embassy in Myanmar handed over five off-road vehicles to the Myanmar Peace Commission (MPC) at the National Reconciliation and Peace Center in Yangon. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.

evidence: Donation of off-road vehicles to Myanmar Peace Commission, government/civil society sector

title: CIDCA funds upgrade of the No. (2) Industrial Training Center in Mandalay, Myanmar in 2019
description: According to a news release from the Chinese Embassy in Myanmar, on March 14, 2019, the Myanmar government signed an exchange of letters with China International Development Cooperation Agency (CIDCA) to upgrade the No. (2) Industrial Training Center in Mandalay, one of eight vocational training centers established by the Myanmar Ministry of Industry. On January 17, 2020, during the visit of President Xi Jinping to Myanmar, the Implementation Agreement for the project was signed between the Burmese and Chinese Minister of Commerce Zhong Shan ("State Counsellor, President Xi Jinping hold bilateral talks, witness signing 33 agreements").  The project includes the construction and reconstruction of training workshops, the provision of professional training equipment and teaching materials, and the training of Myanmar teachers ("援缅甸曼德勒工业培训中心升级改造项目举行启动仪式"). Previously, the training center offered four courses to 160 trainees yearly; upon completion of the upgrading project, two new courses will be added, for a total of six courses and 240 skilled workers per year.  A consortium of East China Architectural Design and Research Institute Co., Ltd. and Shanghai Modern Architectural Design Group Engineering Construction Consulting Co., Ltd. will manage the project, while Jiangxi China Coal Construction Group Co., Ltd will be responsible for the construction work. An opening ceremony for construction on the project was held on December 8, 2021. The construction period will last 26 months ("援缅甸曼德勒工业培训中心升级改造项目举行启动仪式"). Official construction starts on April 8, 2022.
staff_comments: The Chinese title for this project is 缅甸曼德勒工业培训中心升级改造项目, while the Burmese title is အမှတ် (၂)စက်မှုသင်တန်းကျောင်း(မန္တလေး) အဆင့်မြင့်တင်ခြင်းစီမံကိန်
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
CIDCA funds upgrade of the No. (2) Industrial Training Center in Mandalay, Myanmar in 2019

# Description
According to a news release from the Chinese Embassy in Myanmar, on March 14, 2019, the Myanmar government signed an exchange of letters with China International Development Cooperation Agency (CIDCA) to upgrade the No. (2) Industrial Training Center in Mandalay, one of eight vocational training centers established by the Myanmar Ministry of Industry. On January 17, 2020, during the visit of President Xi Jinping to Myanmar, the Implementation Agreement for the project was signed between the Burmese and Chinese Minister of Commerce Zhong Shan ("State Counsellor, President Xi Jinping hold bilateral talks, witness signing 33 agreements").  The project includes the construction and reconstruction of training workshops, the provision of professional training equipment and teaching materials, and the training of Myanmar teachers ("援缅甸曼德勒工业培训中心升级改造项目举行启动仪式"). Previously, the training center offered four courses to 160 trainees yearly; upon completion of the upgrading project, two new courses will be added, for a total of six courses and 240 skilled workers per year.  A consortium of East China Architectural Design and Research Institute Co., Ltd. and Shanghai Modern Architectural Design Group Engineering Construction Consulting Co., Ltd. will manage the project, while Jiangxi China Coal Construction Group Co., Ltd will be responsible for the construction work. An opening ceremony for construction on the project was held on December 8, 2021. The construction period will last 26 months ("援缅甸曼德勒工业培训中心升级改造项目举行启动仪式"). Official construction starts on April 8, 2022.
justification: Project focuses on education and vocational training without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Upgrade of vocational training center, focus on construction of training workshops and provision of educational materials

title: Bank of China provides $100 million loan for Phase III (Part 1) of Myanmar Communication Infrastructure Construction Project (Linked to Project ID#63327, #63665, #64443)
description: In 2019, Bank of China (Hong Kong) Ltd. (BOC (HK)) and Myanmar Fiber Optic Communication Network Co., Ltd. (MFOCN or 缅甸光纤通信网络有限公司) — a project company and subsidiary of HyalRoute Communication Group Ltd. (HyalRoute) — signed a $100 million buyer’s credit loan agreement for Phase III (Part 1) of Myanmar Communication Infrastructure Construction Project. The borrowing terms of the loan are unknown. However, it is known that the loan was secured by (i.e. collateralized against) fiber optic network assets and an account pledge. It is also known that the loan is backed by a 15-year, $115,370,375 guarantee (covering the loan’s principal and interest) from the Multilateral Investment Guarantee Agency (MIGA). HyalRoute also made a $12.4 million equity contribution to MFOCN for Phase III (Part 1).   The project constitutes Phase III-1 of a national program involving the installation of 62,000km of national fiber optic cable network and 1,000 telecom towers between 2012-2023 (the Program). Phase I of the program (2012-2016) entailed the construction of 17,401 km of the fiber optic cable (FOC) backbone. Phase II of the program (2017-2018) included the construction of 14,599km of fiber optic network. MIGA provided two guarantees for Phase II covering the installation of a total of 8,500km of FOC backbone. The remaining 30,493km of FOC are to be built in three phases (III, IV, and V) between 2019 and 2023.   In the first part of phase III of the program, MFOCN will aim to lay down 4,300 km direct-buried backbone FOC in 7 states and 200 km of duct-buried routes in urban areas in Myanmar. Construction of FOC involves digging a trench approximately 30-50 cm wide and 1.2 – 1.5 m deep, laying the FOC and then back filling the trench. In urban areas FOC is duct buried, and in peri-urban and rural areas the FOC is directly buried. The FOC network includes the construction of two types of ‘core facilities’, where FOC connects to communications equipment: type A (200 m2) and type B (60 m2). Both facilities include a base transceiver station (BTS), electricity transformer, backup generator and an area reserved for telecommunication towers (if required). Type A core facilities will also have an equipment laydown area and accommodation for the maintenance teams. Core facilities have a dual purpose: i) to provide greater capacity for the operators in the telecommunication sector and ii) to improve both outdoor and indoor coverage for service providers. FOC route is designed by the MFOCN’s construction planning department. Designs are completed section by section, and submitted to Myanmar’s National telecommunications authority - Post and Telecommunication Department (PTD) and Local Development Committee (and in some places, the municipal construction management department) for approval. Construction is carried out section by section and each section is typically between 1-3 km long. Construction of a section can take up to 3 months from early engagement of local communities to completion, involving around 250 workers over the period. Construction activities are carried out during September-May period to avoid rainy seasons whereby flooding and rains render construction difficult. Where an area may pose problems (e.g. community reluctance), MFOCN has considerable technical flexibility in planning an alternative route to avoid a potential problem area.
staff_comments: 1. The MIGA project identification number is MIGA-14433. A MIGA Board vote was taken on this project on June 11, 2019. The guarantee went into effect on June 26, 2019. 2. Phase I and Phase II of this project were financed by China Eximbank, ICBC, and Bank of China (as captured via Project ID#63327, ID#63665, and ID#64443).3. This project is also known as the Third HyalRoute Fiber Optic Cable Network Project. 4. HyalRoute Communication Group Limited is a Singapore-based company that is owned by HyalRoute Group, a Shenzhen-headquartered telecom infrastructure company. 5. Myanmar Fiber Optic Communication Network Co., Ltd (MFOCN) was established on May 22, 2012.6. The Multilateral Investment Guarantee Agency (MIGA) is a member of the World Bank Group.  MIGA provides political risk insurance (guarantees) for projects in a broad range of sectors in developing member countries, covering all regions of the world.
combined_text:
# Sector
COMMUNICATIONS

# Title
Bank of China provides $100 million loan for Phase III (Part 1) of Myanmar Communication Infrastructure Construction Project (Linked to Project ID#63327, #63665, #64443)

# Description
In 2019, Bank of China (Hong Kong) Ltd. (BOC (HK)) and Myanmar Fiber Optic Communication Network Co., Ltd. (MFOCN or 缅甸光纤通信网络有限公司) — a project company and subsidiary of HyalRoute Communication Group Ltd. (HyalRoute) — signed a $100 million buyer’s credit loan agreement for Phase III (Part 1) of Myanmar Communication Infrastructure Construction Project. The borrowing terms of the loan are unknown. However, it is known that the loan was secured by (i.e. collateralized against) fiber optic network assets and an account pledge. It is also known that the loan is backed by a 15-year, $115,370,375 guarantee (covering the loan’s principal and interest) from the Multilateral Investment Guarantee Agency (MIGA). HyalRoute also made a $12.4 million equity contribution to MFOCN for Phase III (Part 1).   The project constitutes Phase III-1 of a national program involving the installation of 62,000km of national fiber optic cable network and 1,000 telecom towers between 2012-2023 (the Program). Phase II of the program (2017-2018) included the construction of 14,599km of fiber optic network. MIGA provided two guarantees for Phase II covering the installation of a total of 8,500km of FOC backbone. The remaining 30,493km of FOC are to be built in three phases (III, IV, and V) between 2019 and 2023.   In the first part of phase III of the program, MFOCN will aim to lay down 4,300 km direct-buried backbone FOC in 7 states and 200 km of duct-buried routes in urban areas in Myanmar. Core facilities have a dual purpose: i) to provide greater capacity for the operators in the telecommunication sector and ii) to improve both outdoor and indoor coverage for service providers. Construction of a section can take up to 3 months from early engagement of local communities to completion, involving around 250 workers over the period. Where an area may pose problems (e.g. community reluctance), MFOCN has considerable technical flexibility in planning an alternative route to avoid a potential problem area.
justification: Project focuses on communication infrastructure development without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Installation of fiber optic cable network and telecom towers, no direct energy or environmental components mentioned

title: Chinese Embassy donates digital dictionaries in the reception ceremony for Chinese Language Training courses in 2019 (Linked to 64169)
description: On December 10, 2019, Chinese consular Fan Feng (潘峰) in the Chinese Embassy's Culture Office attended the concluding ceremony for Chinese Language Training courses. As #64169 indicated, the training course was supported by the Embassy but hosted by the Confucius Institute in Naypyidaw.  During the ceremony, the Chinese donated Chinese CDs and digital dictionaries for the trainees.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Description
On December 10, 2019, Chinese consular Fan Feng (潘峰) in the Chinese Embassy's Culture Office attended the concluding ceremony for Chinese Language Training courses. As #64169 indicated, the training course was supported by the Embassy but hosted by the Confucius Institute in Naypyidaw.  During the ceremony, the Chinese donated Chinese CDs and digital dictionaries for the trainees.
justification: Project focuses on language education and cultural exchange without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Chinese language training courses, donation of educational materials (CDs and digital dictionaries)

title: Chinese Ministry of Commerce Hosts Hybrid Rice Training Seminar for Myanmar in 2019
description: On October 21, 2019, the Chinese Ministry of Commerce and Myanmar's Ministry of Agricultural, Animal Husbandry, and Irrigation launched a training seminar on the cultivation of hybrid rice in Myanmar. The opening ceremony was held at the Agricultural Research Institute in Nay Pyi Taw, Myanmar.   The training will focus on the introduction of comprehensive hybrid rice technology, including hybrid rice genetics and breeding technology, hybrid rice seed production technology and hybrid rice high-yield cultivation technology, as well as training activities on other topics such as China's national conditions, achievements in reform and opening up, and Chinese culture. The training lasted 45 days and 60 officials, technicians and major planters from the agricultural field in Myanmar participated. Yuan Long Ping High-Tech Agriculture Co., Ltd. provided experts in the seminar.   On December 4, 2019, Business Consular Tan Shufu (谭书富) of the Chinese Embassy and other officials in Myanmar attended the closing ceremony.
combined_text:
# Sector
AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY, FISHING

# Title
Chinese Ministry of Commerce Hosts Hybrid Rice Training Seminar for Myanmar in 2019

# Description
On October 21, 2019, the Chinese Ministry of Commerce and Myanmar's Ministry of Agricultural, Animal Husbandry, and Irrigation launched a training seminar on the cultivation of hybrid rice in Myanmar. The opening ceremony was held at the Agricultural Research Institute in Nay Pyi Taw, Myanmar.   The training will focus on the introduction of comprehensive hybrid rice technology, including hybrid rice genetics and breeding technology, hybrid rice seed production technology and hybrid rice high-yield cultivation technology, as well as training activities on other topics such as China's national conditions, achievements in reform and opening up, and Chinese culture. The training lasted 45 days and 60 officials, technicians and major planters from the agricultural field in Myanmar participated. Yuan Long Ping High-Tech Agriculture Co., Ltd. provided experts in the seminar.   On December 4, 2019, Business Consular Tan Shufu (谭书富) of the Chinese Embassy and other officials in Myanmar attended the closing ceremony.
justification: Project focuses on agricultural training and knowledge sharing without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Training seminar on hybrid rice cultivation, focus on agricultural technology transfer and cultural exchange

title: Chinese Embassy establishes 'Ambassador's Library' in a primary school in Dawei, Myanmar in 2019
description: On November 28, 2019, Consular Pan Feng in the Culture Office in the Chinese Embassy went to a local primary school, 金土瓦小学 (English translation is not found), in Dawei City, Drindaye Province, Myanmar. He, on behalf of the ambassador, donated books in the Chinese language and established the Ambassador's Library for the children there.

title: Chinese Embassy donates computers and office supplies to the Supreme Court of Myanmar in 2019
description: On November 26, 2019, the Chinese Embassy in Myanmar donated computers and other office supplies to the Supreme Court of the Union of Myanmar. Chinese Ambassador to Myanmar Chen Hai (陈海) and the Chief Justice of the Supreme Court of the Union of Myanmar U Htun Htun Oo attended the handover ceremony. According to a report from Yunnan Gateway, 70 sets of computer equipment were provided.
combined_text:

Chinese Ambassador to Myanmar Chen Hai (陈海) and the Chief Justice of the Supreme Court of the Union of Myanmar U Htun Htun Oo attended the handover ceremony. According to a report from Yunnan Gateway, 70 sets of computer equipment were provided.

title: Chinese Embassy hosts new media training course for Myanmar officials in Beijing
description: According to a news release from the Embassy of China in Myanmar, from November 18 to 22, 2019, the Chinese Embassy hosted a new media training course for Burmese officials in Beijing.   During the seminar, 10 officials from Myanmar Ministry of Information went to see the headquarters of Chinese media companies such as People's Daily, China International Publishing House, and Global Network, and visited the Big Data Center of Communication University of China and Huawei's Beijing exhibition hall, and exchanged views with Chinese scholars on new media capacity building. During the visit they also visited the China-ASEAN Center.  The officials stated that the training deepened their understanding of the development of new media in China, which will help promote exchanges and cooperation in the media field between the two countries.
combined_text:
# Sector
GOVERNMENT AND CIVIL SOCIETY

# Title
Chinese Embassy hosts new media training course for Myanmar officials in Beijing

# Description

During the visit they also visited the China-ASEAN Center.  The officials stated that the training deepened their understanding of the development of new media in China, which will help promote exchanges and cooperation in the media field between the two countries.
justification: Project focuses on media training and capacity building, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: New media training course, visits to media companies and cultural institutions, focus on media capacity building

title: Chinese Embassy donates 7.5 million kyat worth of resources to 23rd China/Myanmar Friendship School in 2019
description: On November 21, 2019, Chinese Embassy in Myanmar donated 7.5 million kyats worth of resources (oil, rice) and school supplies to the 23rd China/Myanmar Friendship School (掸邦昂米达亚佛寺学校) in Lashio, Shan State. Consular Li Xiaoyan and the head of the school attended the donation ceremony.

justification: Project involves donation of resources and school supplies to an educational institution, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of oil, rice, and school supplies to China/Myanmar Friendship School
